sentence.Network_en: Its $25m reserve fund had been run down to around $8m.
sentence.Network_cn: 其2,500万美元的储备金已被减少到了800万美元左右。

sentence.Network_en: The property business could be sold or run down.
sentence.Network_cn: 可售出或削减房地产业务。

sentence.Network_en: He bought a run-down television station.
sentence.Network_cn: 他买下了一个不景气的电视台。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 劳字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 劳劳〖 disconsolate;melancholy〗 劳累〖 over-worked;run-down;tired〗 劳力〖 labor;manpower〗.
新概念第四册单词总汇[旺旺英语论坛] ... long-drawn 漫长的 run-down 破旧的 flown 刚出巢的.
大学英语精读单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... corporation n. 有限公司 run-down a. 破败的， 情况不佳的 renovate vt. 修复， 修整.
Dealing with Growth ... 18.decrepit adj. 破旧的，失修的 19.run-down adj. 失修的，破败的 20.concrete adj. 混凝土的.

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... run away with (感情等)战胜 run down 跑下；撞倒；追捕到 run into 跑进；偶然遇到；共计.
英语运动类单词_爱问知识人 ... assist 助杀 run down 夹杀 double play,double kill 双杀.

entry.tran: 疲惫不堪的;累病的;衰弱的
entry.def: If someone is run-down, they are tired or slightly ill.

example.ex: ...times when you are feeling tired and run-down.
example.tran: 你感觉疲惫不堪的时候

entry.tran: (建筑物、地区等)破旧不堪的，破败的，失修的
entry.def: A run-down building or area is in very poor condition.

example.ex: ...one of the most run-down areas in Scotland.
example.tran: 苏格兰最破败的地区之一

entry.def: A run-down place of business is not as active as it used to be or does not have many customers.

example.ex: He bought a run-down television station.
example.tran: 他买下了一个不景气的电视台。

entry.tran: （行业、组织等规模的）缩减，紧缩
entry.def: When the run-down of an industry or organization takes place, its size or the amount of work that it does is reduced.

example.ex: ...the impetus behind the rundown of the coal industry.
example.tran: 促使煤炭行业紧缩的原因

entry.def: If you give someone a run-down of a group of things or a run-down on something, you give them details about it.

example.ex: Here's a rundown of the options...
example.tran: 以下是能有的各项选择。

example.ex: This full-colour supplement includes full race details, plus a comprehensive run-down on all the British hopefuls.
example.tran: 这份全彩附录包含了完整的比赛信息和对所有可能获胜的英国运动员的详细介绍。

means.word_mean: 1. worn and broken down by hard use;

sentences.sentence: "a decrepit bus...its seats held together with friction tape"

auth_sentence.content: Here is an all-too-short run-down on some of them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Here is an all-too-short run-down on some of them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Here is an all-too-short run-down on some of them.

auth_sentence.content: Early man could run down any prey including neanderthal.
auth_sentence.res_content: Early man could run down any prey including neanderthal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Early man could run down any prey including neanderthal.

auth_sentence.content: Times Money provides a run-down on the Isa rules.
auth_sentence.res_content: Times Money provides a run-down on the Isa rules.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Times Money provides a run-down on the Isa rules.

means.word_mean: (钟、表等)发条走完的;(电池)耗尽的

sentences.en: Standing on the table was a run-down clock.
sentences.cn: 桌子上放着一只走停了的钟。

sentences.en: We’re completely run-down and need a thorough rest.
sentences.cn: 我们精疲力尽了,需要彻底休息。

sentences.en: We will plan to rehabilitate the run-down neighborhood.
sentences.cn: 我们计划重建这个破落的街区。

sentences.en: I bought a run-down farm house and plan to fix it up.
sentences.cn: 我买了一间破败的农舍,打算整修整修。
